bill_title: prohibit the dissemination of incorrect or misleading ballot information and to provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to provide for the dissemination of a facsimile of a ballot and to prohibit the dissemination of incorrect or misleading election information. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 12-16: If a person disseminates a facsimile of a ballot as part of campaign material requiring disclosure or statement pursuant to chapter 12-27, the facsimile must be identical to the sample ballot posted by a county auditor, as required by § 12-16-16. For the purposes of this section, the term "campaign material" means any literature or publication that is disseminated for the purposes of influencing a voter to vote for or against a particular ballot question or candidate for public office at a primary or other election. The term does not include a news item or an editorial comment published by the news media. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 12-26: No person may knowingly and purposely disseminate information pertaining to the conduct of an election that is incorrect, misleading, or indicates that the information is from an official source. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

An Act to prohibit the dissemination of incorrect or misleading ballot information and to provide a penalty therefor. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 12-13: Any person who knowingly prints, publishes, or delivers to any voter of this state a document containing a facsimile of an official sample ballot or a portion thereof purporting to be an official sample ballot as part of campaign material requiring disclosure or statement pursuant to chapter 12-27, in which the ballot or portion thereof is misstated, erroneously printed, or by which false or misleading information about the ballot is given to the voters, is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
